Articles.Content:
Love 21.1 great additions game headed in a good direction. New thing with ASUS using electricity is awesome. Still wish electricity management was more important. ie. lifesupport, more things that run off of electricity in science/utility tabs. meh, if thing uses electricity it means it is a thing that does something, need more things that do something, like idk.. sensor packages... telescopes... robotic arms... cameras... servos... stuff =) Like those attitude fins those should use electricity. currently they move using magic.

I know with the addition of mineable resources we'll have more stuff that runs off electricity. Either way, gj with 21.1 keep up good work.

Toshogu, not to be rude, but most of the stuff you just asked for is either a planned feature or in a mod. Especially the robotic arms and telescopes. The idea about the winglets/control surfaces using electricity is definitely original and unique, but may be more of an annoyance to many planes and Kerbal aviators. Just my opinion.

Edited July 27, 2013 by 0jam3290
Do you know what would be even more important? When they would add a board to this forum where you could suggest features. Wait... there is!

The only times having control surfaces using electricity be an annoyance, would be when gliding (it might even help combat some infini-glider designs) or if you stick an unreasonable amount of them on your plane! Otherwise the jet engine should provide more than enough electricity!

Do you know what would be even more important? When they would add a board to this forum where you could suggest features. Wait... there is!

Yup, that would be very useful if this Thread was aimed at posting some new Idea's to Squad, however it is not, so it clearly should be in... this thread... It is simply a Thread that states they are enjoying 0.21.1 with the new changes, but that the game still feels like it is missing something. Just because people mention "oh it would be great if this or this was introduced" does not mean it should be in the Suggestions Thread...
